Helper Functions (helperFunctions.py)¶

This section contains reusable functions which are called by other functions.

helperFunctions.check_day(date)[source]¶

Checks the day of the date.

helperFunctions.check_eveph(date, e)[source]¶

Checks public holiday eve.

helperFunctions.check_month_num(request_month)[source]¶

Checks the number for the request month.

helperFunctions.check_weekend(date)[source]¶

Checks whether a date is a weekday or weekend.

helperFunctions.clashes(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Check for schedule clashes in Training, Duties and Priority Leave sheets in information_excel.xlsx

Parameters

Training, Duties and Priority Leave sheets in information_excel.xlsx

Returns

dictionary containing date, email, name and sheets with clashes.

For example: {“2021-05-03”: [“leekh@ttsh.com”, “Lee Kang Hao”, [“Training”, “Duty”]]}

helperFunctions.close_connection(conn, cur)[source]¶

Closes a database connection to a SQLite database.

helperFunctions.create_connection()[source]¶

Creates a database connection to a SQLite database.

helperFunctions.email_json(start_dateA, end_dateA)[source]¶

Extracts FormSG emails from Outlook and updates the CallRequest and LeaveApplication tables with these data.

Parameters

start date and end date which specify emails to extract.

helperFunctions.exportScheduleJ()[source]¶

Exports junior doctors timetable as CSV.

Parameters

timetable data from TempJ table

Returns

scheduleJ.xlsx

helperFunctions.exportScheduleS()[source]¶

Exports senior doctors timetable as CSV.

Parameters

timetable data from TempS table

Returns

scheduleS.xlsx

helperFunctions.is_constraint_met(table_name, start_date, end_date)[source]¶

Validates timetable against specified constraints.

Parameters

data from Constraints and Temp tables

Returns

dictionary containing date and list of unmet constraints.

For example: {“01-05-2021 Saturday”: [“total call”, “clinic 1”, “clinic 2”]}

helperFunctions.produce_doctor_dictionary(doc_name, number_of_rows, df)[source]¶

Produces doctor dictionary for past schedule.

Parameters

doctor name, number of rows, dataframe

Returns

nested dictionary containing doctor name, date, activity and remark.

For example: {“Dr Lee”: {“01-05-2021 Saturday”: {“Off”: “”}}}

helperFunctions.readCallRequest(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Retrieves call request from CallRequest table.

Parameters

CallRequest table

Returns

dictionary containing doctor emails, date, name, request type, remark.

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:{“2021-05-03”: [“Lee Kang Hao”, “OnCall”, “Mock”]}}

helperFunctions.readDuties(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Reads Duties sheet in information_excel.xlsx and updates Duty table.

Parameters

Duties sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

dictionary of doctor emails and their duties details (name, duty name, start date, end date).

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:[“Lee Kang Hao”, “ICU1”, “5/2/2021”, “5/3/2021”]}

helperFunctions.readLeaveApplication(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Retrieves leave request from LeaveApplication table.

Parameters

LeaveApplication table

Returns

dictionary containing doctor emails, start date, name, leave type, end date, duration and remark.

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:{“2021-05-03”: [“Lee Kang Hao”, “AnnualLeave”, “2021-05-05”, “PM”, “Mock”]}}

helperFunctions.readPh()[source]¶

Reads Public Holiday sheet in information_excel.xlsx.

Parameters

Public Holiday sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

dictionary containing date, day and holiday name.

For example: {“1/1/2020”:[“New Year’s Day”, “Wednesday”]}

helperFunctions.readPrevCalls()[source]¶

Reads Last 2 Days Calls sheet in information_excel.xlsx.

Parameters

Last 2 Days Calls sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

list containing dictionaries of call date and email.

For example: [{“2/1/2020”, “leekh@ttsh.com”}]

helperFunctions.readRoster()[source]¶

Reads Roster sheet in information_excel.xlsx and updates Roster and Skills tables.

Parameters

Roster sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

dictionary of doctor emails and their roster details (name, first position, second position, posting, skills, type).

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:[“Lee Kang Hao”, “MO2”, “”, “”, [“brain”, “teeth”], “S”]}

helperFunctions.readpleave(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Reads Priority Leave sheet in information_excel.xlsx and updates PriorityLeave table.

Parameters

Priority Leave sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

dictionary of doctor emails and their training details (name, leave reason, start date, end date).

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:[“Lee Kang Hao”, “Annual Leave”, “5/2/2021”, “5/3/2021”]}

helperFunctions.readtraining(query_start_date, query_last_date)[source]¶

Reads Training sheet in information_excel.xlsx and updates Training table.

Parameters

Training sheet in information_excel.xlsx*

Returns

dictionary of doctor emails and their training details (name, training, start date, end date).

For example: {“leekh@ttsh.com”:[“Lee Kang Hao”, “Refresher”, “5/2/2021”, “5/3/2021”]}
